definition: to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to grasp (often fig.)/to control/to seize (initiative, opportunity, destiny)/to master/to know well/to understand sth well and know how to use it/fluency
to grasp (also fig.)/to seize/to hold/assurance/certainty/sure (of the outcome)
to hold firmly, not let go
(fig.) to hold in one's hands/to be within grasp
to be in a position of power
lit. to hold the pearl of wisdom (idiom)/fig. to be endowed with extraordinary intelligence

sentences.english: In which of the following ways the handgrip work?
sentences.chinese: 下面哪個是握柄的工作原理？

sentences.english: To improve your tennis strokes you try using a different grip.
sentences.chinese: 爲了提高你網球的擊球法，你試試用另一種握拍方法。

sentences.english: If your using the continental grip, your toss will be slightly over the left shoulder if your right handed.
sentences.chinese: 如果你用大陸式握拍，你的拋球應該稍稍過左肩。

sentences.english: Gatsby and I in turn leaned down and took the small reluctant hand.
sentences.chinese: 蓋茨比和我先後彎下腰來，握一握不情願的小手。

sentences.english: They shook and greeted with each other.
sentences.chinese: 他們握了握手，互致問候。

sentences.english: " He reached across the table and took her hand in his own suddenly, squeezing it.
sentences.chinese: 他突然靠向餐桌捉住了麗的手，握在了自己的手中。

sentences.english: Even I don't feel like moving my hand which holds the mouse.
sentences.chinese: 甚至握着鼠標的手都懶得挪一下位置。

sentences.english: Do not derange the bridle hand.
sentences.chinese: 注意握繮繩的手不要動。

sentences.english: Such doubts have not stopped China claiming mastery over the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 這種懷疑並沒有妨礙中國宣稱已把雲朵握在手中。

sentences.english: The front door of the office flew open. In burst a young man with a gun.
sentences.chinese: 店門突然推開，衝了進來的是個少年郎，手中握着槍。

sentences.english: He cwase running here with one hand holding a knife.
sentences.chinese: 他手上握着刀向這裏跑來。

sentences.english: She allowed him to hold her hand, but forbade him any intimacies.
sentences.chinese: 她讓他握着手，但不許他有過份親密的行動。

sentences.english: Samuel holds the phone to his ear till the dial tone goes busy.
sentences.chinese: 塞繆爾僵硬的握着話筒，直到對面傳來嘟嘟的忙音。

sentences.english: This grip also comes with stainless steel bar that removes onion smell.
sentences.chinese: 這款握柄同樣用不鏽鋼棒材製成，可去除洋蔥的氣味。

sentences.english: Mirella approached him and, after a brief hesitation, shook his hand.
sentences.chinese: 米雷拉走近他，猶豫片刻後，和他握了握手。

sentences.english: Life is full of surprises The kite you're flying might suddenly sail away.
sentences.chinese: 人生總有許多意外，握在手裏的風箏也會突然斷了線。

definition: to hold firmly, not let go
palm (of one's hand)/control (extended meaning from having something in the palm of one's hand)
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to release/to let go/to loosen/to untie/to come loose
in hand/(a situation is) in sb's hands
to weigh in the hand/to estimate
